description:
'''Power metal''' is a subgenre of [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] combining characteristics of traditional heavy metal with [[speed metal]], often within a [[symphony|symphonic]] context. Generally, power metal is characterized by a faster, lighter, and more uplifting sound, in contrast with the heaviness and dissonance prevalent in, for example, [[extreme metal]]. Power metal bands usually have anthemic songs with fantasy-based subject matter and strong choruses, thus creating a theatrical, dramatic and emotionally "powerful" sound.

The term was first used in the mid-1980s and refers to two different but related styles:
* the first largely practiced in North America with a harder sound similar to speed metal;
* a later, more widespread and popular style based in Europe<ref name="Rockdetectorstyles">{{Cite book|last1=Sharpe-Young|first1= Garry|author-link1= MusicMight|title= A–Z of Power Metal|series= Rockdetector Series|year= 2003|publisher= Cherry Red Books|isbn= 978-1-901447-13-2}} "American metal such as Queensrÿche, Attacker, Jag Panzer, Iced Earth, Liege Lord, and Savatage; European bands such as Helloween, Gamma Ray, Blind Guardian, Running Wild, and Grave Digger;"</ref> with a lighter, more melodic sound and frequent use of [[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]].
